concise_definition: v. 巩固, 合并, 统一

definitions.explanation_en: To combine separate elements, organizations, or systems into a single, more unified and efficient whole, often to strengthen overall function or stability.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将多个独立的元素、组织或系统合并为一个更统一、更高效的整体，通常是为了增强整体功能或稳定性。
definitions.example_en: The two companies consolidated their operations to reduce costs and improve efficiency.
definitions.example_cn: 这两家公司合并了运营以降低成本并提高效率。

definitions.explanation_en: To make something stronger, more secure, or more firmly established, especially after a period of weakness or fragmentation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指使某事物变得更强大、更稳固或更牢固地确立，尤其在经历虚弱或分裂之后。
definitions.example_en: After the election, the new prime minister worked to consolidate her power.
definitions.example_cn: 选举后，新任总理努力巩固自己的权力。

definitions.explanation_en: To bring together and integrate resources, debts, or assets into a single entity or plan for better management.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将资源、债务或资产整合为一个单一实体或计划，以便更好地管理。
definitions.example_en: He consolidated all his credit card debts into one loan with a lower interest rate.
definitions.example_cn: 他将所有信用卡债务合并为一笔利率更低的贷款。

comparison.analysis: “Merge” (合并) 强调两个或多个实体在形式或结构上结合为一个，通常保留各自的部分特征，但不必然强调结果的稳固性或效率提升。而 “consolidate” 更注重合并后的整合、强化和优化，常带有战略目的。
“Unify” (统一) 侧重于消除分歧、使不同部分在目标、意志或认同上达成一致，常用于政治、文化或意识形态层面。而 “consolidate” 更侧重于通过结构或资源的整合来实现稳定和效率，不一定涉及思想或情感的统一。
“Strengthen” (加强) 是一个更宽泛的词，泛指增强力量、能力或稳定性，但不涉及合并或整合的过程。而 “consolidate” 通常包含“合并”作为实现“加强”的手段，具有更具体的行动内涵。
